lines.text: [Tim shoots the gun out of Hawk's hand when the henchman tries to shoot Bob in the back]
Hello, Bob.

[to Hawk]
Aw, hold still. It's only a crease.
How do you like my new gun?
Shoots right were you aim it, don't it.
Welcome, stranger! The years haven't changed you a bit.
Years?
Since I saw you last, silly!
I guess I asked for it, Sue, but they've been workin' us Rangers to the bone. Rustlers are so thick, they're ridin' two on a horse, so you see, I can't stay long.
Look, kid, I'm on your side, but you got me aimin' in the dark.
[Bob Crandall, working undercover, leads the Rangers to the gunrunning gang's wagons]
We gotta get outta here in a hurry!
What happened?
We ran right into a trap set by Crandall.
Crandall?
He decided he'd rather be a Ranger. Smart kid.
That's treachery!
[Largo stumbles over the bag of loot Hatfield planned to steal from his fellow gang members]
You almost got away with it, Hatfield!
[Largo shoots the turncoat]
I liked you, you skunk.
[after a spectacular wagon wreck, Bob tries to help the injured Largo]
Reach, Ranger!
Alright, Largo, why don't you shoot?
[Largo drops his gun]
I guess we both got our limit of skunks tonight, kid. Let's call it quits.
[last lines]
T-Bone, this is delicious. What is it?
I ain't gonna tell you, Miss Sue. This is my own concoction.
[Ordway rushes into the dining room]
What happened to you?
Sorry to be late but somebody stole my horse.
[the rangers all look disgustedly at their meat]
T-bone!
I-I didn't mean nothin' by it, Mister Bob!
Then you did steal it!
Yessir. I mean, no sir. That is, I just kinda borrowed it to get this here meat for the barbeque!
[to Ordway]
Your horse is right in the barn, sir.
